oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Why? Find Out! Everthing is Interesting
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Photograph of poster created as part of the New York State Art Project, Monroe County, Rochester, New York, as part of the WPA. Illustrated in Marlene Park & Gerald E. Markowitz, New Deal for Art: The Government Art Projects of the 1930s with Examples from New York City & State, Hamilton, NY: Gallery Association of New York State, 1977, p.120, figure 128. Per the book, "Erik Hans Krause was the supervisor of the WPA/FAP in Rochester between 1936 and 1939."
Children's Behavior #3
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Krause, Erik Hans
